entries.meaning: Any of the long boards laid over joists to make a floor.

examples: The officers said they found two rifles in the car, one on the front floorboard of the vehicle and another on the rear floorboard.

verbs.description: floorboard (third-person singular simple present floorboards, present participle floorboarding, simple past and past participle floorboarded)

entries.meaning: To sink the gas pedal into the floorboard of the car, in order to bring the car to the highest possible speed.
examples: I floorboarded the gas pedal and cut over sharply to the right, threatening the Cadillac's fenders and its driver's life.
